{appName} will use the location for setting up your timezone. You can always change this later in your computer's settings.

{appName} will open the requested link in an external application. If you do not trust this link, or do not recognize it, click Deny. You can always change this later in your computer's settings.

renderer.components.settingsPage.afterRe: Setting takes effect after restarting the app.
renderer.components.settingsPage.appLang: Chooses the language that the desktop app will use for menu items and popups. Still in beta, some languages will be missing translation strings.
renderer.components.settingsPage.bounceI: If enabled, the dock icon bounces once or until the user opens the app when a new notification is received.
renderer.components.settingsPage.checkSp: Highlight misspelled words in your messages based on your system language or language preference.
Specify the url where dictionary definitions can be retrieved
renderer.components.settingsPage.downloa: Specify the folder where files will download.
renderer.components.settingsPage.enableH: If enabled, {appName} UI is rendered more efficiently but can lead to decreased stability for some systems.
renderer.components.settingsPage.enableM: Send anonymous usage data to your configured projects
Sends usage data about the application and its performance to your configured projects that accept it.
renderer.components.settingsPage.flashWi: Flash taskbar icon when a new message is received
If enabled, the taskbar icon will flash for a few seconds when a new message is received.
This functionality may not work with all Linux window managers.
renderer.components.settingsPage.fullscr: If enabled, the {appName} application will always open in full screen
renderer.components.settingsPage.launchA: If enabled, the app will start in system tray, and will not show the window on launch.
renderer.components.settingsPage.logging: Logging is helpful for developers and support to isolate issues you may be encountering with the desktop app.
Increasing the log level increases disk space usage and can impact performance. We recommend only increasing the log level if you are having issues.
renderer.components.settingsPage.minimiz: Leave app running in notification area when application window is closed
If enabled, the app stays running in the notification area after app window is closed.
Can't save your changes. Please try again.
renderer.components.settingsPage.showUnr: Show red badge on {taskbar} icon to indicate unread messages
Regardless of this setting, mentions are always indicated with a red badge and item count on the {taskbar} icon.
renderer.components.settingsPage.startAp: If enabled, the app starts automatically when you log in to your machine.
renderer.components.settingsPage.trayIco: Show icon in the notification area
Show {appName} icon in the menu bar
renderer.components.settingsPage.updates: If enabled, updates to the desktop app will download automatically and you will be notified when ready to install.
renderer.components.welcomeScreen.slides: Ship your product on time, every time, with a project and task management solution built for digital operations.
When typing isn’t fast enough, seamlessly move from chat to audio calls and screenshare without switching tools.

All your team's communication in one place.

Secure collaboration, built for developers.
Collaborate effectively with persistent channels, file and code snippet sharing, and workflow automation purpose-built for technical teams.
Execute and automate workflows with flexible, custom integrations with popular technical tools like GitHub, GitLab, and ServiceNow.
Move faster and make fewer mistakes with checklists, automations and tool integrations that power your team's workflows.
Platrum Chat is an open-source collaboration platform for mission-critical work. Secure, flexible, and integrated with the tools you love.
